page.title: 0733 ENGINEER REGIMENT EOD
page.content: Lodge Hill is the main training area for all the units based at Chattenden. It is also the base of 33 Engineering Regiment(EOD). The EOD stands for Explosive Ordnance Disposal and is the modern name for Bomb Disposal. 33 Regiment are also hosts to the combined services Defense Explosive Ordnance School and the Nato Explosive Ordnance Disposal Technical Imformation Centre. 33 Regiments main jobs are to dispose of bombs which are still left around the British Isles from World War 2, clear training areas, and the training of soldiers for disposing of enemy bombs in the event of another war. An active Bomb Disposal team is on 24 hour standby all the year round at Lodge Hill. They get called out some 40 to 50 times a year and may have to go anywhere in England.
